page.title: 01Introduction to Yewdale
page.content: The area in the block consists of about 70% rugged hill country & about 30% lower land in the valleys. A number of clear, fast-flowing, rocky streams run south & south_east to{Coniston}Water, close to the southern border of the block. The Coniston Fells form much of the land over 300m. The peaks of{The {Old Man}&{Wetherlam}are just outside the block. The glaciated valleys are steep sided and narrow.{Yewdale}is the main valley and it contains the A 593 Coniston_Ambleside road. Most people live at the southern edge of the block which has the northern part of Coniston in it. Other people live on farms in the valleys. The moorland is covered by heather & rocky hill areas, with deciduous woodland & rough grazing in valleys.
